reference.title: apiSyntaxItem
reference.shortdesc: The <apiSyntaxItem> element provides the programming language representation of the declared interface for the API item.

refbody.section: DescriptionIn the <apiDef> element, the <apiSyntaxItem> element can supplement or replace the semantic declaration of the same interface. When a specialization provides a complete representation of the interface within a specialized <apiDef> element, the <apiSyntaxItem> element is omitted. The Java DITA API reference takes this approach.
refbody.example: ExampleThe following example shows an <apiSyntaxItem> element for a Visual Basic function:<apiClassifier id="com.ibm.xtools.rational.xde"> <apiName>IRXEAbstraction</apiName> <shortdesc> Represents a semantic mapping between elements that characterize the same concept. </shortdesc> <apiClassifierDetail > <apiSyntax> <apiSyntaxText>IRXEAbstraction</apiSyntaxText> </apiSyntax> </apiClassifier>
